infodynamics.measures.discrete

Class ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculatorDiscrete

  • java.lang.Object
    • infodynamics.measures.discrete.InfoMeasureCalculatorDiscrete
      • infodynamics.measures.discrete.ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculatorDiscrete

  • public class ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculatorDiscrete
extends InfoMeasureCalculatorDiscrete

    Implements conditional transfer entropy for univariate discrete time-series data. That is, it is applied to int[] data, indexed by time. See Schreiber below for the definition of transfer entropy, and Lizier et al (2008, 2010). for the definition of local transfer entropy and conditional TE, which is TE conditioned on one or more other potential sources. This is also called complete TE when all other causal sources are conditioned on.

    Usage of the child classes implementing this interface is intended to follow this paradigm:

    1. Construct the calculator via ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculatorDiscrete(int, int, int);
    2. Initialise the calculator using initialise();
    3. Provide the observations/samples for the calculator to set up the PDFs, using one or more calls to the set of addObservations(int[], int[], int[]) methods, then
    4. Compute the required quantities, being one or more of:
      • the average TE: computeAverageLocalOfObservations();
      • the local TE values for these samples: #computeLocalOfPreviousObservations()
      • local TE values for a specific set of samples: e.g. #computeLocalFromPreviousObservations(int[], int[]) etc.
      • the distribution of TE values under the null hypothesis of no relationship between source and destination values: computeSignificance(int) or #computeSignificance(int[][]).
    5. As an alternative to steps 3 and 4, the user may undertake standalone computation from a single set of observations, via e.g.: #computeLocal(int[], int[]) or #computeAverageLocal(int[][], int).
    6. Return to step 2 to re-use the calculator on a new data set.

    The conditional sources (specified using either their offsets from the destination variable or their absolute column numbers in the multivariate data set) should be supplied in the same order in every method call, otherwise the answer supplied will be incorrect.

    Note for developers: Ideally, this class would extend ContextOfPastMeasure, however by conditioning on other info contributors, we need to alter the arrays pastCount and nextPastCount to consider all conditioned variables (i.e. other sources) also.

    TODO Add methods for passing in single time series. This is done for addObservations, but not other routines. TODO Implement AnalyticNullDistributionComputer

    References:

    • T. Schreiber, "Measuring information transfer", Physical Review Letters 85 (2) pp.461-464, 2000.
    • J. T. Lizier, M. Prokopenko and A. Zomaya, "Local information transfer as a spatiotemporal filter for complex systems" Physical Review E 77, 026110, 2008.
    • J. T. Lizier, M. Prokopenko and A. Zomaya, "Information modification and particle collisions in distributed computation" Chaos 20, 3, 037109 (2010).
    Author:
    Joseph Lizier (email, www)

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculatorDiscrete

        public ConditionalTransferEntropyCalculatorDiscrete(int base,
                                            int history,
                                            int numOtherInfoContributors)
        Construct a new instance
        Parameters:
        base - number of symbols for each variable. E.g. binary variables are in base-2.
        history - embedded history length of the destination to condition on - this is k in Schreiber's notation.
        numOtherInfoContributors - number of information contributors (other than the past of the destination or the source) to condition on.

      • addObservations

        public void addObservations(int[] source,
                   int[] dest,
                   int[][] conditionals)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        Add observations for source-destination-conditionals time-series to our estimates of the pdfs.
        Parameters:
        source - source time series
        dest - destination time series. Must be of same length as source.
        conditionals - conditionals multivariate time series, indexed first by time, then by variable number. Must be of same length in time as source, and must be numOtherInfoContributors conditionals here.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • addObservations

        public void addObservations(int[] source,
                   int[] dest,
                   int[] conditionals)
                     throws java.lang.Exception

        Add observations for a single source-destination-conditionals set to our estimates of the pdfs.

        This method takes in a univariate conditionals time series - it is assumed that either numOtherInfoContributors == 1 or the user has combined the multivariate tuples into a single value for each observation, e.g. by calling MatrixUtils.computeCombinedValues(int[][], int). This cannot be checked here however, so use at your own risk!

        Parameters:
        source - source time series
        dest - destination time series. Must be of same length as source.
        conditionals - conditionals univariate time series, indexed first by time, then by variable number. Must be of same length in time as source, and we must have either numOtherInfoContributors=1, or the user has combined the values of the multivariate conditionals time series into single (unique) values at each time step (this is not checked however).
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • addObservations

        public void addObservations(int[][] states,
                   int j,
                   int[] otherSourcesToDestOffsets)
        Add observations in to our estimates of the pdfs from a multivariate time-series of homogeneous variables. This call suitable only for homogeneous agents, as all agents will contribute to single pdfs, and all are assumed to have other info contributors at same offsets.
        Parameters:
        states - multivariate time series, indexed first by time then by variable number.
        j - number of columns to compute transfer entropy across (i.e. for each destination variable i, we have a source at i-j, dest i: transfer is j cells to the right)
        otherSourcesToDestOffsets - offsets of the other information contributors from each destination. (i.e. offsets from each other information source to the destination - the offset is signed the same way as j!) othersOffsets is permitted to include j, it will be ignored.

      • addObservations

        public void addObservations(int[][] states,
                   int sourceCol,
                   int destCol,
                   int[] othersAbsolute)
        Add observations for a single source-destination-conditionals set of the multivariate time series. to our estimates of the pdfs. This call should be made as opposed to addObservations(int states[][]) for computing active info for heterogeneous agents.
        Parameters:
        states - multivariate time series, indexed first by time then by variable number.
        sourceCol - column index of the source
        destCol - column index of the destination
        othersAbsolute - column indices of the conditional variables. othersAbsolute is permitted to include sourceCol or destCol (if k>0), they will be ignored.

      • computeAverageLocalOfObservations

        public double computeAverageLocalOfObservations()
        Description copied from class: InfoMeasureCalculatorDiscrete
        Compute the average value of the measure from the previously-supplied samples.
        Specified by:
        computeAverageLocalOfObservations in class InfoMeasureCalculatorDiscrete
        Returns:
        the estimate of the measure

      • computeSignificance

        public EmpiricalMeasurementDistribution computeSignificance(int numPermutationsToCheck)
        Generate a bootstrapped distribution of what the conditional TE would look like, under a null hypothesis that the source values of our samples had no relation to the destination value (in the context of the destination past and conditionals).

        See Section II.E "Statistical significance testing" of the JIDT paper below for a description of how this is done for MI, conditional MI and TE.

        Note that if several disjoint time-series have been added as observations using #addObservations(int[], int[]) etc., then these separate "trials" will be mixed up in the generation of surrogates here.

        Parameters:
        numPermutationsToCheck - number of surrogate samples to bootstrap to generate the distribution.
        Returns:
        the distribution of conditional TE scores under this null hypothesis.
        See Also:
        "J.T. Lizier, 'JIDT: An information-theoretic toolkit for studying the dynamics of complex systems', 2014."

      • computeLocalFromPreviousObservations

        public double[][] computeLocalFromPreviousObservations(int[][] states,
                                              int j,
                                              int[] otherSourcesToDestOffsets)
        Computes local conditional transfer entropy for the given states, using pdfs built up from observations previously sent in via the addObservations method. This method to be used for homogeneous agents only
        Parameters:
        states - multivariate time series, indexed first by time then by variable number.
        j - number of columns to compute transfer entropy across (i.e. for each destination variable i, we have a source at i-j, dest i: transfer is j cells to the right)
        otherSourcesToDestOffsets - offsets of the other information contributors from each destination. (i.e. offsets from each other information source to the destination - the offset is signed the same way as j!) othersOffsets is permitted to include j, it will be ignored.
        Returns:
        2D time-series of local conditional TE values (indexed as per states)

      • computeLocalFromPreviousObservations

        public double[] computeLocalFromPreviousObservations(int[][] states,
                                            int sourceCol,
                                            int destCol,
                                            int[] othersAbsolute)
        Computes local active information storage for the given states, using pdfs built up from observations previously sent in via the addObservations method. This method is suitable for heterogeneous agents
        Parameters:
        states - multivariate time series, indexed first by time then by variable number.
        sourceCol - column index of the source
        destCol - column index of the destination
        othersAbsolute - column indices of the conditional variables. othersAbsolute is permitted to include sourceCol or destCol (if k>0), they will be ignored.
        Returns:
        time-series of local conditional TE values

      • computeLocal

        public double[][] computeLocal(int[][] states,
                      int j,
                      int[] otherSourcesToDestOffsets)
        Standalone routine to compute local conditional transfer entropy across a 2D spatiotemporal array of the states of homogeneous agents Return a 2D spatiotemporal array of local values. First history rows are zeros This method to be called for homogeneous agents only
        Parameters:
        states - multivariate time series, indexed first by time then by variable number.
        j - number of columns to compute transfer entropy across (i.e. for each destination variable i, we have a source at i-j, dest i: transfer is j cells to the right)
        otherSourcesToDestOffsets - offsets of the other information contributors from each destination. (i.e. offsets from each other information source to the destination - the offset is signed the same way as j!) othersOffsets is permitted to include j, it will be ignored.
        Returns:
        2D time-series of local conditional TE values (indexed as per states)

      • computeAverageLocal

        public double computeAverageLocal(int[][] states,
                         int j,
                         int[] otherSourcesToDestOffsets)
        Standalone routine to compute average conditional transfer entropy across a 2D spatiotemporal array of the states of homogeneous agents Return the average This method to be called for homogeneous agents only
        Parameters:
        states - multivariate time series, indexed first by time then by variable number.
        j - number of columns to compute transfer entropy across (i.e. for each destination variable i, we have a source at i-j, dest i: transfer is j cells to the right)
        otherSourcesToDestOffsets - offsets of the other information contributors from each destination. (i.e. offsets from each other information source to the destination - the offset is signed the same way as j!) othersOffsets is permitted to include j, it will be ignored.
        Returns:
        average conditional TE from these observations

      • computeLocal

        public double[] computeLocal(int[][] states,
                    int sourceCol,
                    int destCol,
                    int[] othersAbsolute)
        Standalone routine to compute local conditional transfer entropy for a specific set of source-destination-conditionals in a multivariate time-series. Return a 2D spatiotemporal array of local values. First history rows are zeros. This method suitable for heterogeneous agents.
        Parameters:
        states - multivariate time series, indexed first by time then by variable number.
        sourceCol - column index of the source
        destCol - column index of the destination
        othersAbsolute - column indices of the conditional variables. othersAbsolute is permitted to include sourceCol or destCol (if k>0), they will be ignored.
        Returns:
        time-series of local conditional TE values for these observations

      • computeAverageLocal

        public double computeAverageLocal(int[][] states,
                         int sourceCol,
                         int destCol,
                         int[] othersAbsolute)
        Standalone routine to compute average conditional transfer entropy for a specific set of source-destination-conditionals in a multivariate time-series. This method suitable for heterogeneous agents
        Parameters:
        states - multivariate time series, indexed first by time then by variable number.
        sourceCol - column index of the source
        destCol - column index of the destination
        othersAbsolute - column indices of the conditional variables. othersAbsolute is permitted to include sourceCol or destCol (if k>0), they will be ignored.
        Returns:
        average conditional transfer entropy for these observations

      • countOfOffsetOthers

        public static int countOfOffsetOthers(int[] otherSourcesToDestOffsets,
                      int j,
                      boolean removeDest)
        Counts the unique information contributors to this node which are not equal to the source at offset j from the destination, or the node itself (offset 0, node itself not included only when removeDest is set to true).

        This is primarily intended for use inside the method, but made public as a utility.

        Parameters:
        otherSourcesToDestOffsets - array of offsets of the destination from each source
        j - offset of the destination from the source
        removeDest - remove the destination itself from the count of offset others.
        Returns:
        the number of unique such sources

      • countOfAbsoluteOthers

        public static int countOfAbsoluteOthers(int[] others,
                        int src,
                        int dest,
                        boolean removeDest)
        Counts the information contributors to the dest which are not equal to src or the node itself (offset 0, node itself not included only when removeDest is set to true)

        This is primarily intended for use inside the method, but made public as a utility.

        Parameters:
        others - array of source indices
        src - current source index we are considering
        dest - current dest index we are considering
        removeDest - remove the destination itself from the count of absolute others.
        Returns:
        the number of unique such sources

      • confirmEnoughOffsetOthers

        public boolean confirmEnoughOffsetOthers(int[] othersOffsets,
                                int j,
                                boolean removeDest)
        Check that the supplied array of offsets as other info contributors is long enough compared to our expectation
        Parameters:
        othersOffsets - array of offsets from each source to the destination
        j - offset from the source to the destination
        removeDest - remove the destination itself from the count of absolute others.
        Returns:
        whether the number of such sources matches what we expect
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the number of such sources does not match.

      • confirmEnoughAbsoluteOthers

        public boolean confirmEnoughAbsoluteOthers(int[] othersAbsolute,
                                  int src,
                                  int dest,
                                  boolean removeDest)
        Check that the supplied array of absolutes as other info contributors is long enough compared to our expectation
        Parameters:
        othersAbsolute - array of source indices
        src - current source index we are considering
        dest - current dest index we are considering
        removeDest - remove the destination itself from the count of absolute others.
        Returns:
        whether the number of such sources matches what we expect
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the number of such sources does not match.

      • cleanOffsetOthers

        public int[] cleanOffsetOthers(int[] othersOffsets,
                      int j,
                      boolean removeDest)
        Returns the information contributors to this node which are not equal to the offset j or the node itself (offset 0, removed only if removeDest is set to true). Checks that there are enough other information contributors.
        Parameters:
        othersOffsets - array of offsets from each source to the destination
        j - offset from the source to the destination
        removeDest - Remove the destination itself from the cleaned other sources (if it is there). Should not be done if k == 0 (because then the destination is not included in the past history)
        Returns:
        othersOffsets with entries for the offending contributors removed (i.e. array may be shortened)

      • cleanAbsoluteOthers

        public int[] cleanAbsoluteOthers(int[] others,
                        int src,
                        int dest,
                        boolean removeDest)
        Returns the information contributors to the dest which are not equal to src or the node itself (offset 0, removed only if removeDest is true). Checks that there are enough other information contributors.
        Parameters:
        others - array of source indices
        src - current source index we are considering
        dest - current dest index we are considering
        removeDest - Remove the destination itself from the cleaned other sources (if it is there). Should not be done if k == 0 (because then the destination is not included in the past history)
        Returns:
        others with entries for the offending contributors removed (i.e. array may be shortened)
